title: Rights and Freedoms in Timor-Leste's Constitution

questions.question: Which article of Timor-Leste's Constitution protects freedom of speech and information?
What does Article 46 of Timor-Leste's Constitution guarantee?
Which of the following is NOT a civil right protected in Timor-Leste's Constitution?
What type of rights does Article 50 of Timor-Leste's Constitution address?
Which article in Timor-Leste's Constitution contains the general limitations clause for rights?
What international document does Timor-Leste's bill of rights closely align with?
choices: African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a social right in Timor-Leste's Constitution?
What does Article 57 of Timor-Leste's Constitution enshrine?
choices: Right to health and medical care
questions.answer: Right to health and medical care

questions.question: Which article of Timor-Leste's Constitution addresses equality and non-discrimination?
What year was the Constitution of the Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste adopted?
Which of the following is a challenge in implementing constitutional rights in Timor-Leste?
What does Article 59 of Timor-Leste's Constitution guarantee?
Which of the following is NOT a criterion for legitimate restrictions on rights according to the module?
What does Article 51 of Timor-Leste's Constitution address?
choices: Right to strike and prohibition of lock-outs
questions.answer: Right to strike and prohibition of lock-outs

questions.question: Which article of Timor-Leste's Constitution protects the right to private property?
What type of rights are considered more challenging to implement due to resource constraints?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a permissible restriction on rights?
What does Article 45 of Timor-Leste's Constitution protect?
choices: Freedom of conscience, religion, and worship
questions.answer: Freedom of conscience, religion, and worship

questions.question: Which article of Timor-Leste's Constitution guarantees the right to social security and assistance?
What concept does the module discuss in relation to economic, social, and cultural rights?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a key civil right in Timor-Leste's Constitution?
What does Article 42 of Timor-Leste's Constitution protect?
Which article of Timor-Leste's Constitution addresses the right to housing?
What role does the module suggest courts play in relation to restrictions on rights?
Which of the following is mentioned as a challenge in implementing the right to education in Timor-Leste?
What does Article 43 of Timor-Leste's Constitution protect?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a type of right protected in Timor-Leste's Constitution?
What does the module suggest about the relationship between individual rights and public interest?
choices: Public interest always overrides individual rights
A balance must be struck between the two
questions.answer: A balance must be struck between the two

questions.question: Which article of Timor-Leste's Constitution addresses equality between women and men?
What does the module suggest about the justiciability of economic, social, and cultural rights?
choices: They are always easily enforceable in court
There are challenges in their justiciability
They are more justiciable than civil and political rights
questions.answer: There are challenges in their justiciability
